I can see why - they're short, accessible and highly visual summaries of a big topic; perhaps we should do more?.}
textBeforeTable: Many of you ask what the most popular resources on the open data sites are. I can usually offer a rough answer, but I thought I'd take a moment to respond to the question properly. There's more analysis below, but here's the summary of most popular pages and downloads from the data site: On Thu, 11/01/2012 Submitted by Tariq Khokhar What's the Most Popular World Bank Open Data? Home > What's the Most Popular World Bank Open Data? http://blogs.worldbank.org/opendata) Open Data ( Published on
textAfterTable: Most Popular Data Downloads 1 GDP [26]and GNI [27]Related Data 2 World Development Indicators XLS [28]/CSV [29]/PDF [30] 3 Country Data: China [31], USA [32], India [33], Brazil [34], Indonesia [35] 4 Foreign Direct Investment [36] & Exports Data [37] 5 Population Data [38] 6 Inflation Data [39] 7 African Development Indicators [40] 8 Country Income Classifications Data [41]   Is this what you were expecting? Does it correspond with how you use the site? How am I doing this analysis? For context: since launch in April 2010, the data site has had over 17 million visits, and over the last 6 months, averaged 740,000 visits per month. Additionally over the last year, the DataBank query tool received 2.8 million visits and the API was used by about 250,000 unique IPs - these last two resources won't factor into the analysis. First, here's the raw data [42] (628KB XLS) I'm working from. I've pulled the last 12 months of usage data for
